Dear Mr. Toutant:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
October 8 and October 12, 2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671 shall not
permit a child caring institution staff member to begin
working unless all of the following has been completed
using the forms, and in the manner, prescribed by the
department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprint-based check of national
crime information databases, unless an alternative criminal
history check has been approved by the federal
government.
(b) A check of Michigan's child abuse and neglect
central registry or Canadian provincial agency as
referenced in R 400.4113(i). (c) A check of other states'
child abuse registry where the person has lived in within
the preceding five years.
Five of ten new hire employee files reviewed lacked required documentation listed in
sub-section a and b above.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
Two of ten new hire employee files reviewed had references obtained after
employment.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(g) If the employee has criminal convictions, the institution
shall complete a written evaluation of the convictions that
addresses the nature of the conviction, the length of time since
the conviction, and the relationship of the conviction to regulated
4

activity for the purpose of determining suitability for employment
in the institution.
One of ten new hire employee files reviewed lacked documentation to determine the
employee’s suitability for employment.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(h) A statement from the employee regarding any
convictions.
One of ten new hire employee files reviewed lacked documentation from the
employee regarding the convictions.
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(j) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
30 days of the completion of the probationary period or within
180 days, whichever is less, and a written evaluation of the
employee’s performance annually thereafter.
One of 13 employee files reviewed lacked a performance evaluation completed by
the facility.
R 400.4114 Tuberculosis screening for employees and volunteers.
The licensee shall document, prior to employment, that each
employee and volunteer who has contact with residents 4 or
more hours per week for more than 2 consecutive weeks is free
from communicable tuberculosis. Freedom from communicable
tuberculosis shall be verified within the 1-year period before
employment and shall be verified every 1 year after the last
verification or prior to the expiration of the current verification.
Four of ten new hire employee files reviewed had the tuberculosis screening
completed after employment.
R 400.4559 Combustible storage.
(2) In an existing facility, combustible materials storage rooms
and hazardous areas, including janitor rooms and closets,
shipping and receiving rooms, kitchen storage rooms, and
maintenance shops approved before these rules take effect,
shall continue to be approved until the facility or portion thereof
5

is remodeled or converted. All features of fire protection,
including fire detection, automatic sprinkler protection, and
required fire separations, shall be properly maintained.
The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection. There is an unauthorized door
stop on the door of the storage room across from the kitchen.
R 400.4555 Smoke barriers.
(1) Smoke barriers with a 1-hour fire resistance rating shall be
provided on each floor used for sleeping rooms for more than 24
residents and shall be so located as to form an area of refuge
on either side that is served with an approved means of egress.
The barriers shall be located as close as possible to the middle
of the floor to be protected and shall extend from outside wall t
outside wall and from the floor through any inter-stud spaces to
the roof or floor structure above.
The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection. The door to the dining room
from Bayside needs to be adjusted so it will close and latch upon release.
R 400.4552 Heating devices and flame producing devices.
(1) In large and secure facilities and all newly constructed and
converted facilities, flame-producing-type heating devices and
incinerators shall be in an enclosure providing at least 1-hour
resistance to fire. Adequate combustion air shall be provided
directly from the outside through a permanently open louver.
Fire dampers are not required in ducts penetrating this
enclosure.
The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection. There are openings around
the heating plant exhaust stacks as they pass through the ceiling into an attic space
and then through the roof. Seal these penetrations with approved fire stopping
materials. For the exhaust stack that runs through a stainless-steel sleeve ensure
that the stack runs through the roof or slide it up into the attic out of the wall so the
ceiling penetration can be sealed. It is important to consult with the manufacturer’s
UL listing details for the correct method for installing whatever product is used.
R 400.4535 Fire Alarm.
(4) Fire alarm systems and devices in existing facilities shall be
maintained in proper working order and shall continue to be
approved until the facility is remodeled or converted
6

The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection. The facility is required to
provide documentation to show that when the valves and fire pump for the fire
sprinkler system are operated during annual inspection / when the fire alarm system
is inspected annually that a signal is received by the fire alarm system.
R 400.4527 Sprinkler systems.
(2) All required sprinkler systems shall be inspected and tested
and all other maintenance performed as specified in the 2014
national fire protection association standard No. 25 entitles
“Standard for the Inspection, Testing , and Maintenance of
Water-Based Fire Protection Systems” at least once a year by a
sprinkler contractor. The licensee shall maintain documentation
of the last inspection and test.
The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection. The facility is required to
provide documentation to show that when the valves and fire pump for the fire
sprinkler system are operated during annual inspection / when the fire alarm system
is inspected annually that a signal is received by the fire alarm system.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are

compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy
requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
 All references need to have a month, day and year listed on the letter. There
were two references that had the month and year on the reference letter.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
During the period under review there have been 3 special investigations. Two
7

investigations resulted in the facility being found in full compliance. One investigation
found the facility in non-compliance. As a result, the facility has submitted one
acceptable corrective action plan not related to maltreatment during this licensing
period. The non-compliance was for staff not maintaining line of sight on youth.
During quarterly unannounced visits and a corrective action plan compliance review,
the agency has successfully implemented all aspects of their corrective action plan.
During the onsite visit, a walkthrough of the facility occurred. Medications were
locked and stored securely. A meal menu was posted, and ample food was present
in the facility. The facility received a C rating on the fire inspection due to needing a
new door to the dining room from Bayside so it will close and latch upon release. A
new door has been ordered by the approved contractor but to date has not arrived.
The Fire Inspector gave a temporary approval until February 1, 2022, for the facility.
Staff reported feeling valued and heard at the agency. Staff and youth both reported
feeling safe at the facility. Youth reported receiving treatment, feeling groups help
them address their addictions and staff being very supportive in their road to
recovery, even after being discharged. Two youth described the facility being the
“best place I’ve ever been.”
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will
be issued a renewal of their regular license.
